intro: Peucedanum gypsaceum, commonly known as the gypsum angelica, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small white to greenish flowers in clustered umbels. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its medicinal properties, though it is less commonly used than other members of its family.
